Knowledge Representation Formalisms. A Summary 
• 
Knowledge representation 
• 
To store knowledge so that programs can process it and achieve the 
verisimilitude of human intelligence 
• 
Knowledge representation formalisms/techniques 
• 
Originated from theories of human information processing.  
• 
Since knowledge is used to achieve intelligent behavior, the fundamental 
goal of knowledge representation is to represent knowledge in a manner as 
to facilitate inferencing i.e. drawing conclusions from knowledge. 
• 
Some examples are: 
•  First order logic 
•  Semantic networks and conceptual maps 
•  Frames 
•  Description logic 
•  Production rules 
•  Fuzzy logic 
•  Bayesian networks 
•  Etc. 
These are the ones  
that we will analyse
